qas.question: Beyonce portrayed which character in the film, Cadillac Records?

qas.question: Where did Beyonce donate her salary from the movie Cadillac Records?

qas.question: Which thriller film did Beyoncé star in with Ali Larter?

context: Beyoncé further expanded her acting career, starring as blues singer <a0_0><a9_0>Etta James<a9_0/><a0_0/> in the 2008 musical biopic, Cadillac Records. Her performance in the film received praise from critics, and she garnered several nominations for her portrayal of James, including a Satellite Award nomination for Best Supporting Actress, and a NAACP Image Award nomination for Outstanding Supporting Actress. Beyoncé donated her entire salary from the film to <a1_0><a5_0><a10_0>Phoenix House<a10_0/><a5_0/><a1_0/>, an organization of rehabilitation centers for heroin addicts around the country. On January 20, 2009, Beyoncé performed James' "<a2_0>At Last<a2_0/>" at <a11_0>the First Couple's first inaugural ball.<a11_0/> Beyoncé starred opposite Ali Larter and Idris Elba in the <a3_0>thriller<a3_0/>, <a6_0><a12_0>Obsessed<a6_0/>.<a12_0/> She played <a7_0>Sharon Charles<a7_0/>, a mother and wife who learns of a woman's obsessive behavior over her husband. Although the film received negative reviews from critics, the movie did well at the US box office, grossing $68 million—$<a8_0>60 million<a8_0/> more than Cadillac Records—on a budget of $20 million. The fight scene finale between Sharon and the character played by Ali Larter also won the 2010 <a4_0>MTV Movie Award for Best Fight<a4_0/>.
